My bill will set new requirements on the DOJ and FBI in order to apply for a surveillance order including requiring that any American target of an order is represented by an attorney.

Recognizing the damage this episode is causing to the ongoing efforts to protect our country from foreign threats, I introduced H.R. 5396, the FISA Improvements Act of 2019. https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/5396 …
In other words, because of the lies of the crossfire hurricane squad, the FISA court is now closed for business. Check back in 3 weeks.
In effect this means that because of the actions of numerous FBI and DOJ officials, including those in leadership, there is a halt on granting new surveillance orders.

Judge Collyer, in her order, admonished the FBI for serious lack of candor in the @carterwpage FISA application (lying to the court). She also told the FBI to demonstrate why any interim application before the court should be considered reliable.

Collectively, the actions of these individuals has diminished strong bipartisan Congressional support for critical national security tools. My legislation will restore support in these tools by establishing new requirements on future FISA applications.

The deceptive actions of a few high-ranking officials within the FBI and Department of Justice have eroded public trust in our federal institutions. They flattened internal guardrails, deceived the FISA court, and irreparably damaged the reputation of an innocent American.

Today I introduced the FISA Improvements Act that will stop abuses of powerful surveillance tools by amending FISA.
